Origins: A photograph purportedly showing a can of Coca-Cola Garlic has been circulating on the Internet since at least 2014. The image is typically accompanied by text explaining this fictional flavor of Coca-Cola is available in Romania:
Description: The above-displayed image, however, was not taken at a grocery store in Romania. The original photograph , taken in France in 2011 by Flickr user Jos Roitberg, showed a can of Coca-Cola Cherry; the original logo was then stripped from it and replaced with a fictional one for Coca-Cola Garlic: As of 2015, there is no garlic Coca-Cola product available in Romania (or elsewhere), but that could change in the future. Food and Wine reported in February 2015 that Takkola, a garlic-flavored cola drink, was the new craze in Japan.
Example: [Collected via Twitter, November 2014] Garlic Coca-Cola, supposedly available at Romania. pic.twitter.com/NzK0FZpIxh I. Thayyib (Thadu) (@3rdu) November 3, 2014
Claim: Photograph shows a can of garlic-flavored Coca-Cola being test-marketed in Romania.
